result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:48 AM Cases 22CF2 and 22CM5 called together.  Defendant Aaron Lee Simmons in court.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin appeared by video for Aaron Lee Simmons.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: comp report filed this morning.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.

11:46 AM Cases 22CF2 and 22CM5 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron Lee Simmons in court.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin appeared by video for Aaron Lee Simmons. Cases on for Status Conference.  Court notes updated report has been filed.  Defense attorney updates the Court: not contesting the report.  State concurs, offers the report into evidence, inquires if the existing order is enough for continued services or if another order will need to be prepared for continued outpatient services.  Court states the current order continues and is sufficient, adopts the recommendation in the report.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Burnett Co Drug Testing Program Chain of Custody Form

No abusive contact with victim in 22CM05.  Property bond of $8,000 (defendant's real property to be used as collateral and bond to be amended to include it once equity information is received).  No contact with the victim in case 22CF02 or their residence. Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any firearms.  Defendant must complete the Domestic Violence Education Program through Restorative Justice.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to submit to random drug testing through Tessa Anderson at defendant's cost of $20 per test.  Defendant is subject to curfew and must be home between the hours of 8 PM- 8 AM.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 11:45 am.

9:43 AM Cases 22CF2 and 22CM5 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron Lee Simmons in court.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin appeared by video for Aaron Lee Simmons. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: inquires of letter filed today (not related to comp); re-evaluation is expected in the next 2-3 weeks regarding competency, and family and victim is requesting that def be allowed to return to the victim's residence.  Victim's daughter makes a statement RE: victim.  Court requests documentation RE: victim for file.  Victim's daughter to file that.  Upon receipt, Court will amend the bond to no abusive contact with the victim.  Court addresses def.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Med record- victim
Burnett Co Drug Testing Program Chain of Custody Form
Order of Commitment for Treatment
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:32 AM Cases 22CF2 and 22CM5 called together.  Defendant, Aaron Lee Simmons, appeared with Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.   Aaron Lee Simmons appeared in person with atty Perrin by video means.  Court makes record RE: findings of comp report.  State not objecting to the report, makes offer of proof of the report into evidence; unsure how to proceed from here.  Atty Perrin not objecting to comp determination.  Court finds def is not comp to proceed to trial at this time, likely to regain comp within permissable timeframe.  DHHS to work with def to regain comp.  Atty Perrin makes record RE: bond modification to allow def to return to the residence.  Court responds, would require programming beyond CRA class, possibly Domestic Violence Education Group; def says he completed that already.  State to confirm VR compliance and victim would also need to complete the class through CRA (VW coordinator to help).  If all done, court would consider modifying to no abusive contact.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Burnett County Drug Testing Program - Chain of Custody Form
From Burnett County Drug Testing Program
Order for Competency Examination by DHS
Status conference on April 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

02:26 PM Defendant, Aaron Lee Simmons, appeared with Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Aaron Lee Simmons appeared in person with his attorney by video.  Court addresses unpaid portion of bond.  Case was set for initial appearance.  Court notes atty Perrin has raised competency.  Court orders competency evaluation.  DA inquires if there is a bond.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Motion for competency evaluation
Order granting defendant's request.

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron Lee Simmons
Current: 200 S Sarah Lane, Apt 5, c/o Anthony Simmons, Somerset, WI 54025 United States  (Effective: 02-09-2022)
Prior: 25586 Gile Rd, Grantsburg, WI 54840
Certificate of Compliance
Initial appearance on February 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Referral form to RJ

Defendant must post an additional $500 cash today and post additional $1000 ($2,000 to be posted total across both cases) by March 1st and property bond of $8,000 (defendant's real property to be used as collateral and bond to be amended to include it once equity information is received).  No contact with the victims in either case or their residences. Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any firearms.  Defendant must complete the Domestic Violence Education Program through Restorative Justice by 3/15/22; must arrange to participate by 1/15/2022.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to submit to random drug testing through Tessa Anderson at defendant's cost of $20 per test. Defendant must be accompanied by one of his children when outside of his residence. Defendant is subject to curfew and must be home between the hours of 8 PM- 8 AM.  Defendant must reside with his children until further order of the Court.
No contact with the victim or residence.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any firearms.
